column5: I'm from Woodstock, 20 min east of London.  Thames river sludges it's way through the city and I fish quite a bit in both ends of the river (below and above the Gordon Pittock Reservoir).  Any one ever want to hook up and do some fishing I'm always game.  Would love to get out on LPB for some pike right now.  PB

I make better time with the little guy in tow since he's big enough to carry his own gear now.   Slowpoke meet Pauly, Pauly meet Slowpoke. Now both meet some lpb pike.  Did you get the boat out of storage yet Brian?

Hey Pauly, if we try hard enough maybe we can get John out of the house some weekend for fishing! John, got the boat out of storage today. I was thinking of going to LPB today since I was half way there but it looks a little grim and really windy. Fishing from the couch today! -Brian
Sorry to hear that.  It was 22C and sunny when we took to the sea for some cod on Friday.  Report to follow next week when I get back.  BTW enjoy the snow on Wednesday!!  jjcanoe in the wooden shoe

Currently residing in Toronto, but I grew up in London and cut my teeth fishing the mighty Thames. We lived one block from Greenway Park and a ten minute bike ride to Springbank Dam. I fished, virtually anywhere on the Thames from Nilestown, downstream to Delaware. Mostly walkin/wading the river in search of smallies, but also enjoyed fishin the dam in the fall for ... believe it or not, steelhead, lakers, chinnies and coho! Of course, the mighty river hogg (carp) was a favorite foe during the hot summer months and the river never failed to provide all the fertilizer my mom's roses could eat! Also caught many bowfins, white perch, crappies, perch, gar, the occasional pike and of course, before the run was decimated pickereyes! It really is a great place to learn and practice your skills, with the variety of species available. HH
You miserable P----! I hope you wore your arms out! I have something here for you to pick up... $25.00. You probably won't need them for your brookie trip so no rush to come by. -Brian
10-4 Thanks for getting them.  jjcanoe
I am from Stratford
Londoner here! i live in the masonville area......  OFC tim hortons meetup?
Watford Rocks! I am right in the middle of it all. Lake Erie, Lake Huron and St. Clair River.  Bing

in the next few yrs (when i can afford a down payment on a house) we plan on moving out there.  nice city, with nice country areas nearby... just dunno about fishing opportunities out there.  other than the big lakes of course
I live right at the forks of the Thames.  I can walk about 2-3 mins and fish all 3 branches

Umm... there is a great CARP river in St Thomas! just ask my little daughter, Botbot, she caught a 25lb one there on her first day fishing ever. ( see a pic on the post " my daughters first time fishing")
We live in London too.  Splashhopper and Botbot

There is a ton of local reports for the London and South western area of the province @ skunked.ca I find you need to use several boards to find good data before you load up the truck and boat to head out. With the price of Gas I use this board skuked,ca and spoon pullers and am usually not dissapointed when I fish a new area. People who use all of the boards I belong to are mostly selfless adn do their best to help you out.

For the last 25 years I've been lucky to live by Lake Huron in what used to be known as Bosanquet Twp but now called Lambton Shores.  We are near ( 7 km ) the town of Forest about 60 Km or an hour from London.  Like it here as much as I did when we first moved here and I'm old enough that by the time "progress"  ( known as more subdivisions ) come around I'll be gone!
East london.........Ahhhh,whats a floaty ??

It seems there are many folks in the Toronto ,Hamilton and Northern areas on this board, many being friends and live close to each other. So I wondered how many folks live in  London  or surrounding area.

Guess nobody is from this area. Seems like this board is mostly friends from areas I mentioned above. Come on there are thousands of fisherman between London and Windsor. Maybe they are too busy fishing today and tonight to be in here.
Theres a few of us in K-town....some in London, some south as well. Dotted all over I guess
im in london wanna go fishing? right by white oaks mall

I currently live in Waterloo but am originally from Aylmer, so I fish mostly around the London area, Long Point Bay is currently my favourite smallmouth fishery, I only fished the Eastern Tribs this year because I went to school in Lindsay, next fall I will be back at my nice relaxing non-touched tribs, this summer I won't be fishing that area at all...but if you are still in the area next fall we can get together for some fishing.....

I live somewhere between Langton, ON and Port Rowan. tobacco country.  Went to school in London and loved it.  If I had to live in a city that's probably where I'd live. Grew up in Sudbury, ON way to F'n cold.  Cheers, UF
I am 10 minutes East of London.
Goderich
I live in London when I'm not wandering around on the Thames somewhere.

I Live in London(south end)  Wouldn't want to move....unless it was in Kawarthas/Haliburtons right on the water.  I have been trying to make it to one of the local OFC Swills but seems something has always come up. DANG!!  FT
I reside in Stratford.... I "live" on either Lake Erie or Lake Huron when I am there fishing.
im in caledonia kinda close lol
I moved to north london about 8 months ago.  Sarnia 10 years prior to that.   Rob v
Theres more than a few of us around London. We even been known to have a G2G or 2/3/4 in south London at times. Myself I'm from 15 mins. northeast of the London Airport.  Best Wishes: Rick
ST.Thomas right in the middle of probably the worst fishing in ontario without driving a hour or so in any direction.
I live in London about a 3 minute walk from the best bass pond in southern Ontario.  jjcanoe
I'm a London Kid too!!  Hey JJ were's that bass pond at?!?! LOL
shhhh it's a secret!  jjcanoe
riverside and wharncliffe area here...thames is my backyard...
I live a little east of London where one can walk on top of "floaties"  on the Thames, during certain times of year. I'd fish more locally but one gets tired of carp.
And 9 minutes with little J in tow! I think I'm going to borrow the neighbours canoe and explore sometime with ya. -Brian
Me too. I mean live in Stratford. I usually just wade the Thames hunting little bitty smallmouths and little bitty pike, tripping over the ubiquitous carp and suckers.  JF
Bathurst & King.  Wanna link up and feeessshhhh?!

Your from Aylmer that explains alot! LOL joking... I lived in St. Thomas while going to University... made friends with alot of the "mexicans" while there.... Them Mennonites sure know how to party!  G
